=== Near-surface state and diagnostic variables for subtypes ===

The variable written as level height parameter is obtained by combination of subtype and sublevel parameters: LEV = LTYPE + JTYPE. E.g. the two-metre temperature over forest is now denoted by combination of parameters IPAR = 11, LTYP = 105, LEV = 805. The following variables may have subtype values:

|| temperature of snow covering tiles 3 and 4  || K || 011  || 105  || 706  || fc ||  || 
|| temperature of snow in the forest  || K || 011  || 105  || 707  || fc ||  || 
|| water in open land snow  || m3/m3  || 086  || 105  || 706  || fc ||  || 
|| water in forest snow  || m3/m3  || 086  || 105  || 707  || fc ||  || 
|| water equivalent of snowpack/snow cover || m  || 066  || 105  || 901-907  || fc || always zero for tiles 6 and 7 ||
|| canopy snow water equivalence || m  || 066  || 105  || 605  || fc ||  ||
|| snow albedo  || fraction  || 190  || 105  || 901-907  || fc || || 
|| snow density  ||  || 191  || 105  || 901-907  || fc ||  ||
|| fraction of snow on ice || fraction  || 194  || 105  || 702  || fc || as compared to whole grid ||
|| fraction of snow on open land || fraction  || 194  || 105  || 706  || fc || as compared to whole grid ||
|| fraction of snow in the forest || fraction  || 194  || 105  || 707  || fc || as compared to whole grid ||
